cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest across the northern Leeward Islands, then forecast to turn northwest toward the Turks & Caicos, Bahamas, and ultimately the Florida peninsula late this weekend

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches confined to Hispaniola, Turks & Caicos, SE Bahamas, and eastern Cuba â€“ none yet for U.S. coastline
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings limited to northern Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, portions of Dominican Republic and Guadeloupe
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands to Turks & Caicos, Bahamas, Cuba and eventually the Florida peninsula
weather_observation.wind: Low (4%) chance of sustained 34-kt winds late in the 5-day window; virtually no risk ( <3% ) for 50-kt or higher winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Savannah within the 5-day forecast, but surge risk would increase if the track shifts north after Florida landfall.
weather_observation.rainfall: Significant rainfall not expected at Savannah within 5 days; heavy rains would only occur if Irma tracks northward after Florida landfall next week.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increasing swells and rip currents possible along the Georgia coast late in the forecast period.
